meanings.definition: The process of understanding by which newly observed qualities of an object are related to past experience.
meanings.sent1: Her apperception of the painting was influenced by her art classes.
meanings.sent2: Through apperception, he connected the new scientific concept to his previous knowledge.
meanings.sent3: During the art exhibition, her apperception of the abstract sculpture led to an unexpected interpretation.
meanings.sent4: His apperception of the situation was like fitting puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent5: The child's apperception of colors was enhanced by the vibrant rainbow.

meanings.definition: The mental process by which a person makes sense of an idea by assimilating it to the body of ideas he or she already possesses.
meanings.sent1: His apperception of the complex theory was aided by his prior knowledge in physics.
meanings.sent2: Through apperception, she integrated the new concept into her existing beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's apperception of the joke resulted in an unexpected punchline.
meanings.sent4: Her apperception of the novel idea was like adding a new book to a well-stocked library.
meanings.sent5: The student's apperception of history was enriched by visiting historical sites.
